forecast.name: Overnight
forecast.detailedForecast: Mostly cloudy, with a low around 46. Northwest wind around 7 mph.

forecast.name: Monday
forecast.detailedForecast: Partly sunny. High near 63, with temperatures falling to around 60 in the afternoon. North wind 2 to 16 mph, with gusts as high as 20 mph.

weather_report:
The crisp night air over Downtown San Francisco carries an anticipatory calm, with clouds weaving a subtle canopy overhead. As the city sleeps beneath this gentle blanket, temperatures flirt softly with the mid-forties, inviting warm layers for those venturing outside. Tomorrow heralds the return of sunlight, as it cuts through the overnight clouds, promising a partly sunny disposition. While the high reaches for the low sixties, the afternoon may bring a refreshing chill, nudging temperatures down to the delightful low sixties and accompanied by an invigorating breeze from the north.

As morning dawns, expect fog to linger, particularly shrouding the edges where land meets the bay, softening the outlines of familiar monuments. The marine layer will ebb and flow, teasing visibility yet adding an ethereal quality to the golden hues of daybreak. It may be prudent to don a light jacket and closed shoes as one embarks on this invigorating day. A leisurely stroll along the waterfront or savoring a warm beverage at a local café might enrich the experience, as would a visit to the nearby parks where the fresh air revitalizes both body and spirit. Embrace the day’s charm by exploring the vibrant neighborhoods or perhaps indulging in some quiet reflection in a serene corner of the city.
